it.polito.nffg.neo4j.manager

Enum Neo4jLibrary

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<Neo4jLibrary>
      • it.polito.nffg.neo4j.manager.Neo4jLibrary
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<Neo4jLibrary>

    public enum Neo4jLibrary
extends java.lang.Enum<Neo4jLibrary>
    The Neo4jLibrary is an enumeration with only one possible value, then is a natural singleton. This feature is guaranteed by the JVM.

      • createNffg

        public java.lang.Integer createNffg(Nffg graph)
                             throws java.lang.Exception
        Save a new graph into the Neo4j database.
        Parameters:
        graph - the Network Function Forwarding Graph we want to save into the database.
        Returns:
        the id assigned to the graph into the database.
        Throws:
        MyConstraintViolationException - if a validation error occurs during the process.
        java.lang.Exception - in case of any other unpredictable errors.
        See Also:
        Nffg, Integer, MyConstraintViolationException, Exception

      • createNffgs

        public void createNffgs(NffgSet graphs)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
        Save into the Neo4j database some new graphs.
        Parameters:
        graphs - the list of graphs we want to save into the database.
        Throws:
        MyConstraintViolationException - if a validation error occurs during the process.
        java.lang.Exception - in case of any other unpredictable errors.
        See Also:
        NffgSet, MyConstraintViolationException, Exception

      • retrieveNffgs

        public NffgSet retrieveNffgs(java.lang.String... ids)
                      throws java.lang.Exception
        Load some graphs from Neo4j database and create with them an instance of NffgSet.
        Parameters:
        ids - array whose length is variable that contains the graphIds we want to retrieve.
        Returns:
        the instance of NffgSet that contains the graphs specified, or all graphs if the first element of array parameter is equal to 'all'.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - in case of any unpredictable errors.
        See Also:
        NffgSet, String, Exception

      • retrieveNffg

        public Nffg retrieveNffg(java.lang.String id)
                  throws java.lang.Exception
        Load the graph specified by parameter id from Neo4j database and create with it an instance of Nffg.
        Parameters:
        id - the graphId of the graph we want to retrieve.
        Returns:
        the instance of Nffg with the graph retrieved or null if doesn't exist a graph whose id is equal to the passed one.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - in case of any unpredictable errors.
        See Also:
        Nffg, String, Exception

      • deleteNffgs

        public void deleteNffgs(java.lang.String... ids)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
        Delete some graphs from Neo4j database.
        Parameters:
        ids - array whose length is variable that contains the ids of the graphs we want to delete (if the first element of the array is equal to 'all', all graphs saved into the database will be deleted).
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - in case of any unpredictable errors.
        See Also:
        String, Exception

      • deleteNffg

        public void deleteNffg(java.lang.String id)
                throws java.lang.Exception
        Delete the graph whose id is equal to parameter id, from the Neo4j database.
        Parameters:
        id - the id of the graph we want to delete.
        Throws:
        MyNotFoundException - if there is no graph whose id is equal to the passed one.
        java.lang.Exception - in case of any other unpredictable errors.
        See Also:
        String, MyNotFoundException, Exception

      • findAllPaths

        public java.util.Set<java.lang.String> findAllPaths(java.lang.String nffgId,
                                           java.lang.String srcNodeId,
                                           java.lang.String dstNodeId,
                                           java.lang.String direction)
                                             throws java.lang.Exception
        Calculates and returns the paths from a source node to a destination one within a given graph that is specified by its id.
        Parameters:
        nffgId - the id of the graph.
        srcNodeId - the id of the source node.
        dstNodeId - the id of the destination node.
        direction - the direction considered in the calculation of paths (possible values are 'incoming', 'outgoing' and 'both').
        Returns:
        a Set of String that represent the paths.
        Throws:
        MyNotFoundException - if there is no graph whose id is equal to the passed one, or if this problem affects the source node or the destination one.
        java.lang.Exception - in case of any other unpredictable errors.
        See Also:
        Set, String, MyNotFoundException, Exception
